title: Senior Systems Engineer – Thermal Managment System
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. 
 
Your role and your team: 
We are looking for an outstanding Senior Systems Engineer with electrical engineering background to join our innovative team that will shape the future of urban e-mobility. This position will contribute, as part of an integrated cross-functional team, to the architecture, design, and delivery of the Lilium Jet. In particular, this will include the development of the electrical aspects of the Thermal Management System (TMS) implemented into our e-VTOL. 
We are looking to reinforce our TMS team with a senior level professional, able to cover electrical development aspects. The Senior Systems Engineer is part of an interdisciplinary integrated project team responsible for the complete development of electrical aspects of the TMS from architecture definition, through design, verification and certification up to the delivery of the Lilium aircraft. 
You will have an opportunity to shape the future of mobility by not only defining TMS, but also by developing components and co-ordinating with regulatory partners and suppliers. Building upon your expertise you'll play a key role in bringing our innovative aircraft to life. 
Your Day to Day: 
Electrical systems design of the air conditioning and liquid conditioning systems using equipment rated up to 1000 VDC. 
Specification of system, subsystem, and component requirements, interface management and detailed design 
Support supplier discussion on E&E development topics and equipment qualification 
Network and component modelling and simulation, especially regarding electrothermal and transient behaviour 
Support of flight testing activities, including analysing data from vehicles and laboratories and drawing conclusions 
Performance of troubleshooting, debugging and root cause analysis on vehicles and laboratories 
Specification of laboratory testing 
 Your Profile: 
Minimum 10 years of aerospace experience, with good knowledge of a Part 21J design organisation environment. 
Experience with aircraft vehicle systems development including collaborative system development with TMS applications preferred 
Experience with systems engineering principles (SAE ARP 4754/4761) and airborne hardware and software development processes (RTCA DO-178 and 254) 
Experience with certification of aircraft systems, especially coordinating with regulatory authorities and producing certification plans, compliance documents, V&V and test plans 
Strong knowledge of standards and good practices in electrical wiring, printed circuits, EMC, bonding, insulation, and related electrotechnical components and materials 
Skilled in electrical network modelling and analysis 
Skilled in supporting experimental testing of systems and vehicles, including debugging and data analytics 
Experience with environmental test standards (RTCA DO-160, MIL-STD-810, MIL-HDBK-310) including Electromagnetic Environmental Effects 
Experience with managing suppliers 
High level of self-reliance with the ability to work in a team, as well as autonomous 
Target-oriented, driven workstyle with analytic problem-solving skills are required 
Fluent English language skills are essential, fluent German or any other language would be beneficial 
#LI-K1
Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
